definition: to have a clear conscience/to feel no qualms
fully deserving, without any reservations (idiom); entirely worthy (of a title, honor etc)
lit. look into one's heart, no shame (idiom); with a clear conscience
lit. look into one's heart, no shame (idiom); with a clear conscience

sentences.english: God chose you. Did you deserve it?
sentences.chinese: 上帝选择了你，你受之无愧否？

sentences.english: A clear conscience is a soft pillow.
This is the place that deserves its fame as the center of Binjiang housing in Ningbo.
sentences.chinese: 这里，无愧于宁波滨江居住的核心方向。

sentences.english: You've proved yourself worthy of the title of Jedi Master.
sentences.chinese: 证明了自己无愧于绝地大师的称号。

sentences.english: But I don't have anything like this serenity when I'm writing an essay.
sentences.chinese: 但我写文章时却一点也没法问心无愧。

sentences.english: A:I think he deserved his gold.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他的金牌当之无愧。

sentences.english: Now Amy can serve this favorite with a clear conscience.
sentences.chinese: 现在埃米可以问心无愧地提供这种美味了。

sentences.english: I wish you every success in the future, You are worthysuccess.
sentences.chinese: 我祝你来日事业成功，出类拔萃，成功当之无愧。

sentences.english: Struggle of course is not necessarily earth-shattering, but it must be worthy of the heart.
sentences.chinese: 奋斗的历程不一定是惊天动地，但一定是无愧于心。

sentences.english: Honestly, you go where sufficient affordable are carried head.
sentences.chinese: 问心无愧，已足够你走到哪里都抬得起头。

sentences.english: He is hoping to find a deserving winner.
sentences.chinese: 他希望能找到受之无愧的得主。

sentences.english: And thus Stieglitz deservingly gained the reputation as the "Father of the Contemporary Photography".
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂格利茨也被当之无愧地誉为“当代摄影之父”。

sentences.english: He merited all the praises they give him.
sentences.chinese: 他们给他的所有表扬他都受之无愧。

sentences.english: But we all long for forgiveness, for living without guilt and moving on.
sentences.chinese: 但是我们都渴望宽恕，渴望生活无愧于心。

sentences.english: Rembrandt is a deservedly famous artist .
sentences.chinese: 伦勃朗是个当之无愧的名画家。

sentences.english: May be they are simply great enough to receive without misgiving .
sentences.chinese: 也许他们的生活很伟大，所以受之无愧。

definition: fully deserving, without any reservations (idiom); entirely worthy (of a title, honor etc)
the present age/in office/the current office holder
not to let sb down/to treat sb fairly/be worthy of
to turn up one's nose/to show disdain for/to regard superciliously
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost
lit. name is not in vain (idiom); a fully justified reputation/enjoys a well-deserved reputation
nobody can compete with/unmatched by anybody/without rival
